meanings.definition: The promotion of cooperation and unity among different religious groups.
meanings.sent1: The ecumenics in the community organized a joint event for all religions to come together.
meanings.sent2: She dedicated her life to the ecumenics of various faiths, striving for harmony and understanding.
meanings.sent3: The ecumenics picnic turned into a friendly competition of who could cook the best traditional dish.
meanings.sent4: His speech on ecumenics was a bridge connecting diverse beliefs and fostering mutual respect.
meanings.sent5: The ecumenics initiative created a colorful mosaic of religious traditions blending harmoniously.

meanings.definition: The study of the principles and practices of ecumenical movements.
meanings.sent1: In her research, she delved deep into the history of ecumenics to understand its evolution.
meanings.sent2: The university offered a course on ecumenics, exploring the impact of collaboration among religions.
meanings.sent3: The ecumenics class had a field trip to observe firsthand how different faiths come together in dialogue.
meanings.sent4: Through his studies in ecumenics, he discovered the power of shared values in fostering unity.
meanings.sent5: The library was filled with books on ecumenics, each shedding light on the path to religious harmony.
